clusters.title: Cultural Relics
clusters.description: Sri Lanka is home to numerous ancient monuments and sites of historical significance. The Ruwanwelisaya Stupa, one of the tallest ancient monuments globally, stands at 103 meters. The Sri Maha Bodhi Tree, planted in 288 BC, is a revered site. Additionally, the Dambulla rock temple complex and Kumana Cave paintings both date back over 2,000 years, showcasing the rich cultural heritage of the region.

clusters.title: Historic Capitals
clusters.description: Anuradhapura served as a significant capital for over a millennium, highlighting its historical importance. King Valagamba's brief reign and subsequent 14-year exile mark a turbulent period in its history. Sigiriya, another notable site, was the capital for 18 years, showcasing its historical and architectural significance.

clusters.title: Sigiriya Marvels
clusters.description: Sigiriya, a prominent historical site in Sri Lanka, features a rock fortress rising 200 meters above the jungle, accessible by 1200 steps. The site spans 15 hectares and is located 50km southeast of Anuradhapura. Notably, only 21 of the original 500 damsel images remain, highlighting its rich cultural heritage.

clusters.title: Biodiversity Richness
clusters.description: Sri Lanka is notable for its rich biodiversity and cultural heritage. The country has designated 13% of its land as Wildlife Protected Areas, highlighting its commitment to conservation. It is home to 26 endemic bird species and has a total of 492 bird species recorded. Additionally, UNESCO has recognized six archaeological and two ecological World Heritage Sites in Sri Lanka, underscoring its cultural and natural significance.

Yala National Park covers 979 km².

clusters.title: Wildlife Sanctuaries
clusters.description: Sri Lanka is home to several significant national parks and wildlife sanctuaries. Wilpattu National Park, one of the largest, spans 131,693 hectares and features numerous lakes and diverse elevations. Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage, the largest in Sri Lanka, houses over 90 elephants as of 2023. Minneriya National Park is renowned for hosting the largest gathering of Asian elephants, with numbers reaching 200-300 or more.

clusters.title: Natural Wonders
clusters.description: Sri Lanka is characterized by its extensive coastline, diverse national parks, and significant wildlife protected areas. The island's coastline measures approximately 1,600 kilometers, offering a variety of coastal experiences. Notable national parks include Horton Plains, situated over 2,000 meters above sea level, and Yala National Park, which spans 979 km² but has limited public access. Wildlife protected areas cover over 8,500 km², highlighting the country's commitment to conservation.
